UniprotID	P11387
Accession	P11387;A8KA78;E1P5W3;O43256;Q12855;Q12856;Q15610;Q5TFY3;Q9UJN0
EntryName	TOP1_HUMAN
ProteinName	DNA topoisomerase 1 (EC 5.6.2.1) (DNA topoisomerase I)
GeneName	TOP1
Length	765
Function	Releases the supercoiling and torsional tension of DNA introduced during the DNA replication and transcription by transiently cleaving and rejoining one strand of the DNA duplex. Introduces a single-strand break via transesterification at a target site in duplex DNA. The scissile phosphodiester is attacked by the catalytic tyrosine of the enzyme, resulting in the formation of a DNA-(3'-phosphotyrosyl)-enzyme intermediate and the expulsion of a 5'-OH DNA strand. The free DNA strand then rotates around the intact phosphodiester bond on the opposing strand, thus removing DNA supercoils. Finally, in the religation step, the DNA 5'-OH attacks the covalent intermediate to expel the active-site tyrosine and restore the DNA phosphodiester backbone (By similarity). Regulates the alternative splicing of tissue factor (F3) pre-mRNA in endothelial cells. Involved in the circadian transcription of the core circadian clock component BMAL1 by altering the chromatin structure around the ROR response elements (ROREs) on the BMAL1 promoter.
Subcellular Location	Nucleus; Nucleolus; Nucleus; Nucleoplasm
Disorder	0.9711,0.9534,0.9381,0.9433,0.9287,0.8765,0.8853,0.8623,0.8792,0.8681,0.8741,0.8853,0.8792,0.8942,0.9057,0.8741,0.8872,0.8828,0.8655,0.8741,0.8741,0.8462,0.8872,0.8966,0.9081,0.9151,0.9433,0.9519,0.9606,0.9534,0.9562,0.9547,0.9362,0.9381,0.9190,0.9190,0.9269,0.9269,0.9249,0.9287,0.9415,0.9415,0.9396,0.9396,0.9362,0.9190,0.9230,0.9230,0.9039,0.9013,0.9168,0.9190,0.9151,0.9190,0.9126,0.9126,0.9106,0.9039,0.9211,0.9039,0.8942,0.8894,0.8894,0.8966,0.8741,0.8741,0.8966,0.8894,0.8894,0.8872,0.9081,0.8894,0.8872,0.8920,0.8894,0.8920,0.8872,0.8894,0.8920,0.8713,0.8681,0.8681,0.8565,0.8313,0.8313,0.8462,0.8565,0.8375,0.8343,0.8493,0.8493,0.7951,0.7951,0.7982,0.7843,0.7916,0.7799,0.8050,0.8198,0.7629,0.7718,0.7881,0.8235,0.8530,0.8872,0.8655,0.8565,0.8421,0.8198,0.8530,0.8313,0.8279,0.8421,0.8565,0.8125,0.7672,0.7459,0.7916,0.7982,0.7843,0.8235,0.8162,0.7799,0.7369,0.7331,0.6755,0.6948,0.6948,0.7331,0.7459,0.7120,0.7163,0.7250,0.7331,0.7250,0.7799,0.7718,0.7881,0.7843,0.7415,0.7369,0.7080,0.7036,0.7331,0.7331,0.7036,0.7289,0.7289,0.7250,0.6851,0.6755,0.6661,0.6712,0.6576,0.6089,0.5992,0.5951,0.6661,0.6755,0.6427,0.6661,0.6661,0.6576,0.6531,0.6427,0.6851,0.6712,0.6906,0.6906,0.7036,0.6948,0.7120,0.7080,0.6991,0.6620,0.7369,0.7369,0.7718,0.7755,0.7951,0.7799,0.7547,0.7547,0.7881,0.8235,0.8235,0.7881,0.7982,0.7799,0.7916,0.8050,0.8050,0.7080,0.7080,0.6089,0.5533,0.5296,0.5342,0.5098,0.5055,0.4119,0.4476,0.4619,0.4801,0.4369,0.4017,0.3321,0.3286,0.2503,0.2034,0.2034,0.1942,0.1942,0.2783,0.3117,0.3494,0.3529,0.3392,0.3599,0.3840,0.3149,0.3872,0.3872,0.3356,0.3529,0.4017,0.4256,0.4685,0.4685,0.4685,0.4441,0.3667,0.3599,0.3740,0.3599,0.2918,0.3149,0.3840,0.3392,0.3149,0.3117,0.3740,0.3631,0.3392,0.3872,0.3182,0.3087,0.2951,0.2541,0.1823,0.2470,0.3087,0.3599,0.3019,0.3019,0.3149,0.3631,0.3019,0.3117,0.3631,0.3599,0.3392,0.2884,0.2164,0.2164,0.2094,0.2715,0.1969,0.1251,0.1852,0.2680,0.1914,0.2002,0.2164,0.2783,0.2436,0.2399,0.2503,0.3356,0.3392,0.3321,0.3494,0.2849,0.2817,0.3 PTM	Acetylation:101,117,134,137,148,150,172,202,204,218,223,239,245,252,262,271,280,284,291,299,336,347,354,388,436,443,456,484,493,540,545,549,575,587,615,642,650,673,712,720,735,742;Glycosylation:296;Methylation:239,252,262,336,362,374,388,532,567,575,603,654,700;Phosphorylation:2,10,21,57,73,97,111,112,125,211,298,394,426,432,433,686,723;SUMOylation:101,103,106,117,130,134,137,148,153,158,164,172,184,191,196,202,204,223,252,291,299,336,354,369,436,549,642,700,712;Ubiquitylation:134,148,218,223,239,245,252,262,354,388,391,400,484,493,545,549,575,587,603,615,642,712,720,734,742,746
